description: Some 300 military and national guard troops were deployed this weekend to hunt for the killers of a mayoral candidate in the northern Mexican state of Tamaulipas, local media reported.
title: Mexico Sends Troops to Border State Town After Candidate Killed

description: With Beijing already becoming a top target in the US election campaign, President Xi Jinping’s government is resisting any move that could backfire on the world’s second-largest economy.
title: China Braces for Worst as It Becomes Punching Bag in US Election

description: US approval of more than $60 billion in aid throws a lifeline to Ukraine’s beleaguered military, though it’s unlikely to turn the tide in the war on its own.
title: US Aid Gives Kyiv Respite But Battlefield Shift Remains Far Off

description: Rishi Sunak will have lawmakers sit late Monday to consider legislation on his flagship migration policy before he embarks on a European tour to defend his record on defense, as the UK prime minister seeks to regain momentum 10 days from a crucial set of local elections.
title: Sunak Eyes Rwanda Vote and Europe Trip to Boost Election Hopes

description: The volume of complaints in the UK about debanking increased by almost half in the last tax year, underscoring the interest Nigel Farage has drawn to the topic through his furious public response to the closing of his accounts.
title: Debanking Complaints Are Spiking After Farage Furore

description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Terry Anderson, the globe-trotting Associated Press correspondent who became one of America’s longest-held hostages after he was snatched from a street in war-torn Lebanon in 1985 and held for nearly seven years, has died at 76.
title: Terry Anderson, AP Reporter Held Captive for Years, Has Died

description: Two Basque nationalist parties tied as winners of legislative elections in the northern Spanish region, leaving Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez’s third-place Socialists as the kingmaker.
title: Sanchez Becomes Kingmaker as Basque Allies Tie in Spanish Vote

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is optimistic on his country’s economic prospects, citing record employment and slowing inflation thanks to falling energy costs.
title: Scholz Optimistic on German Economy, Citing Inflation and Jobs

description: A branch of Moldova’s pro-Russian opposition met in Moscow on Sunday to create a new anti-European political bloc that aims to derail the nation’s planned European Union accession process.
title: Moldova’s Pro-Russia Parties Gather in Moscow to Plot Strategy

description: Former Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro praised Elon Musk as a free-speech advocate, in his latest effort to build opposition to the country’s Supreme Court as his legal troubles mount.
title: Bolsonaro Praises Musk at Rio Rally as His Legal Troubles Grow

description: Donald Trump spent $4.9 million on legal fees in March and has just $6.8 million left in the accounts he’s been using to fund his lawyers, setting him up for a cash crunch as his trial costs mount, according to campaign finance filings.
title: Trump Has Only $6.8 Million for Legal Fees With Trial Underway

description: A Conservative lawmaker facing misconduct allegations said he’ll stand down as a Member of Parliament at the next election, leaving Prime Minister Rishi Sunak struggling to stem the spread of scandals engulfing his party.
title: Sunak’s Tories Dealt a Fresh Blow as Cash Claims Lawmaker Quits

description: New US support gives Ukraine the potential to retake the initiative in its fight against Russia’s invasion, said President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.
title: Zelenskiy Says US Aid Gives Ukraine Means to Retake Initiative

description: Iran’s supreme leader praised the country’s retaliatory strike against Israel a week ago, even as he dismissed Tehran’s low success rate in hitting targets as an insignificant matter.
title: Iran’s Supreme Leader: Number of Missiles That Hit Israel ‘Trivial Issue’

description: Polls are open in Ecuador for a referendum that would allow the extradition of mafia bosses to US prisons, in a first hard test of President Daniel Noboa’s popularity.
title: Ecuador Votes on Extradition for Mafia Bosses in Key Test for Noboa

description: World financial leaders are pushing to overhaul a system for sovereign debt restructurings that has left poor countries locked out of capital markets as China’s emergence as a key player upends traditional negotiations.
title: Pressure Mounts at IMF Against Blueprint for EM Debt Reworks

description: Ukrainian authorities were jubilant at the approval in the US House of more than $60 billion in aid, though focus is shifting to how quickly assistance can get to the front line and how the package will change Kyiv’s fortunes.
title: Ukraine Cheers US Aid as Kyiv Seeks to Reverse Military Setbacks

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu condemned a reported US plan to sanction an ultra-Orthodox army battalion over human rights abuses in the West Bank, a move which could fuel tensions over Israel’s war against Hamas in Gaza.
title: Netanyahu Condemns Reported US Plan to Blacklist Military Unit

description: RAFAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israeli strikes on the southern Gaza city of Rafah overnight killed 18 people, including 14 children, health officials said Sunday, as the United States was on track to approve billions of dollars of additional military aid to its close ally.
title: Israeli Strikes on Southern Gaza City of Rafah Kill 13, Mostly Children

description: One crew member died and seven were missing after two Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force helicopters are believed to have crashed in the Pacific Ocean, according to the defense ministry and the local media.
title: One Dead, Seven Missing After Japanese Navy Helicopters Crash
